key_title: Key to the species of Cycnogeton

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Juncaginaceae

leads.lead_text: Tubers small, mostly 4.5–13 mm long, often near-globular, clustered closely beneath the rhizome; fruits 7–9.6 mm long, very broadly obovoid with base contracted and stalk-like; mature carpels (5 or) 6, dorsal surface of each ± flat or shallowly indented, never keeled or ridged
Tubers mostly larger, ellipsoid or obloid to very elongated, distanced from the rhizome; fruits not as above; mature carpels keeled or ridged (except in C. dubium)

Leaves 41–450 cm long, to 16 mm wide, linear, usually submerged and isolateral, thin-textured; leaf-sheaths narrow, mostly tightly inrolled and then the width of each usually less than one quarter of the leaf width (as seen in transverse section c. 3 cm below the sheath summit); plant of clear flowing streams

Leaves linear-tapered, emergent, dorsiventral, glossy above, spongy in texture; leaf-sheaths broader, gradually incurved, the width of each usually one third or more of the leaf width, both sheaths often overlapping
Carpels (2–) 3 (–6); mature carpels free, each 7.4–10.5 mm long, smooth, ± circular in cross-section
Carpels (3–) 6 (–8); mature carpels attached ventrally for at least one-fifth of their length, 3–13.7 mm long, with a narrow to broad dorsal keel and mostly also lateral keels or ridges

Fruits small, 3–5 mm long (in Victoria), globular in outline, c. 230–1000 per infructescence, crowded, 14–27 on each centimetre of rachis length; carpels 6 (–8), usually all maturing; mature carpels each with a prominent narrowly obtuse dorsal keel and two prominent lateral keels

Fruits larger, 5.6–14.4 mm long, from depressed-globular to ellipsoid in outline, c. 1–320 per infructescence, mostly touching but not crowded, 3–11 on each centimetre of rachis length; carpels 3–6 (–7), frequently 1 or 2 (–5) aborting or only partially developing; mature carpels each with a prominent to near-absent, broadly obtuse, dorsal keel, the lateral keels often absent or not pronounced

Tubers ± ellipsoid or globular to narrowly obovoid, 8–20 (–28) mm long, length 1–3 times diam.; fruits globular to depressed-globular in outline, usually somewhat broader than long; fruiting carpels ventrally attached along the lower 20–45% of the carpel length; slender plants with leaves to 12 mm wide, scape to 6 mm diam., infructescence 11–19 mm diam

Tubers usually elongated, narrow-ellipsoid to cylindric, less frequently ellipsoid to obovoid, 20–145 mm long, length 2.5–20 times diam.; fruits mostly globular-ellipsoid, broad-obovate or ellipsoid in outline, mostly longer than broad; fruiting carpels ventrally attached along 45–80% of the carpel length; sometimes slender but usually robust plants with leaves 5–41 mm wide, scape 4–23 mm diam., infructescence 17–42 mm diam
